pr_title: Add AbstractBaseITCase to make integration test consistent with the help of reading root from System Property

timeline.bodyText: Can we have multiple beforealls? Like if a class that extends this abstract test wants to use a beforeall, do both work?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Yes we can and subclasses's beforeAll runs after the base class's beforeAll. KernelTest overrides storage from console to a file since it currently relies on watching the file for verification
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText:
Get rid of the catch and fail. Just throw from the test.
Why did you make this change, maybe I'm missing something?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Good catch. I think I copied the old version when changing it... Will get rid of it
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: quit? Since this is a property that can't be fixed by a deployment.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I thought about just System.exit(1) but there are other logic related to this broken so I didn't bother changing it now...

timeline.bodyText: Seems like you should be setting the value as the dflt on line 121 from the system property?

replies.bodyText: Yeah. Line 144 sets it and Line 145 updates the prefs
replies.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: Right, maybe just remove the dflt then? Since it will never be used.

replies.bodyText: Removed. I also removed the "stickiness" with Preference, because now it is a required when starting JVM every time. But I'm not sure how James thinks about it....but I guess we can always add it back.

timeline.bodyText: Not a big deal, but I don't like this class name. Can we just go with AbstractTest? or similar

replies.bodyText: Great question. IT stands for "Integration Test" per maven's standard. Added this to the PR description!
